text: Naum Ilyich Idelson (Наум Ильич Идельсон in Russian) (March 1(13), 1885, Saint Petersburg - July 14, 1951, Leningrad) was a Soviet theoretical astronomer and expert in history of physics and mathematics. The crater Idelson on the Moon is named after him. ==References== ==Further reading== Category:Russian astronomers Category:1885 births Category:1951 deaths Category:People from Saint Petersburg
title: Naum Idelson
